body.p: FBReaderJ is an e-book reader for the Android platform. It is a clone of the FBReader book reader written in Java by the same authors. FBReaderJ supports several e-book formats: oeb, epub, fb2. In future releases the list will be extended to support the same formats as the original FBReader. Direct reading from zip, tar and gzip archives is supported.
You can configure FBReaderJ to read books with a pleasure. Colors, fonts, key bindings and many other properties can be changed in the Preferences Dialog.
FBReaderJ is distributed under the terms of the GNU GPL.
There are 2 ways to add book into FBReaderJ library.
The first one is to copy book file to your device into the directory /sdcard/Books (or any its subdirectory). FBReader will add this book automatically.

The second way is to click a book link (i.e. on a link to a file with extension .epub, .oeb, .fb2 or .fb2.zip) in the standard Android browser. A book will be downloaded to the device and opened in FBReaderJ. If you'll click the same link again, a book will not be downloaded again, local copy will be used for reading.
More information about FBReader and FBReaderJ can be found at FBReader site.
If you want to be notified about new releases, please subscribe to FBReaderJ project at freshmeat.
If you have any questions or suggestions, please use FBReader group at googlegroups.
